instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 3437 no bluetooth. Think I have it sorted but not sure.
threads.message:
Had a interesting <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> come in. Liquid damaged. Noticed the airport connector and card was melted. Didn't have a connector so I soldered jumpers to the board. Ghetto? Yes absolutely but it works.

Anyway.. Still no bluetooth. I'm pretty sure I just have to replace <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> and maybe <TRANSISTOR>Q3510</TRANSISTOR> but I also think their is a chance that the PCH is messed up.

Here are my findings

<SIGNAL>BT_WAKE</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PME_WAKE_L</SIGNAL> 3.31v
<SIGNAL>USB_BT_P</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>USB_BT_N</SIGNAL> 0v...... I know this comes from PCH. If the PCH is screwed up I am guessing I could jump 3v here and restore function? (EDIT: This is why I should not be working on boards half asleep. This is a bi directional data line and jumping 3.3v here would be a stupid move.) 
<SIGNAL>USB_BT_CONN_N</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>USB_BT_CONN_P</SIGNAL> 3.3v.

Other than a finstack sensor error (Now resolved) the board works.

threads.title: 3437 no bluetooth. Think I have it sorted but not sure.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>BT_WAKE</SIGNAL> is just to allow BT to wake up the system, BT should work without. Only thing needed for BT to work are J3501 pins 16,17,18 and a good <CHIP>U3510</CHIP>.

threads.title: 3437 no bluetooth. Think I have it sorted but not sure.
threads.message: Well I replaced <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3510</TRANSISTOR>. No change, so Im guessing blown data lines. Going to hook up pins 6 + 7 to spare data lines.
